data.title: BRUTE FORCE
data.statement:
Oh my! The admin password was compromised! 

Luckily, analysis of the server logs showed that not all characters of the password were successfully extracted due to communication disruption.

As part of the CSIRT team it is your job to assess the risk whether the system could have been compromised before the admin password could be changed. Therefore, you have to review the server log and calculate the brute effort to break the admin password. 

We know that the password was contructed out of digits, uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as the characters '#+-%$' (Note that the character ' is a delimiter in this text and not part of the password).
data.constraints:
1 ≤ Length of the server log ≤ 20
1 ≤ number of '*' in the server log ≤ 8
data.inputDescription: Line 1: Server log entry about the retrieved password. A '*' indicates that the corresponding character was not retrieved by the attacker.
data.outputDescription: Line 1: the number of possible combinations of the admin password that is consistent with the server log.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Oh my! The admin password was compromised!

Luckily, analysis of the server logs showed that not all characters of the password were successfully extracted due to communication disruption.

As part of the CSIRT team it is your job to assess the risk whether the system could have been compromised before the admin password could be changed. Therefore, you have to review the server log and calculate the brute effort to break the admin password.

We know that the password was contructed out of digits, uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as the characters '#+-%$' (Note that the character ' is a delimiter in this text and not part of the password).
Input
Line 1: Server log entry about the retrieved password. A '*' indicates that the corresponding character was not retrieved by the attacker.
Output
Line 1: the number of possible combinations of the admin password that is consistent with the server log.
Constraints
1 ≤ Length of the server log ≤ 20
1 ≤ number of '*' in the server log ≤ 8
Example
Input
a
Output
1
